title: Jeff Lendino Sells 3,936 Shares of Jamf Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:JAMF) Stock
text:
Jamf Holding Corp. (NASDAQ:JAMF - Get Free Report) insider Jeff Lendino sold 3,936 shares of the company's stock in a transaction on Wednesday, March 20th. The shares were sold at an average price of $17.90, for a total value of $70,454.40. Following the completion of the transaction, the insider now directly owns 254,926 shares in the company, valued at $4,563,175.40. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which is available through the SEC website. Get Jamf alerts:Sign UpJamf Stock Performance Shares of JAMF traded up $0.26 during trading hours on Thursday, hitting $18.25. The stock had a trading volume of 445,341 shares, compared to its average volume of 416,896. The firm has a market capitalization of $2.32 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of -20.60 and a beta of 0.51. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.51, a quick ratio of 0.95 and a current ratio of 0.95. The firm has a 50-day moving average price of $19.03 and a 200 day moving average price of $17.73. Jamf Holding Corp. has a fifty-two week low of $14.83 and a fifty-two week high of $22.89. Jamf (NASDAQ:JAMF - Get Free Report) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, February 27th. The company reported $0.01 earnings per share for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of ($0.04) by $0.05. Jamf had a negative net margin of 19.64% and a negative return on equity of 6.12%. The business had revenue of $150.65 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $148.34 million. As a group, research analysts anticipate that Jamf Holding Corp. will post -0.03 EPS for the current year. Hedge Funds Weigh In On Jamf A number of hedge funds have recently bought and sold shares of the business. Vanguard Group Inc. raised its stake in shares of Jamf by 1.2% during the 4th quarter. Vanguard Group Inc. now owns 7,277,732 shares of the company's stock worth $131,436,000 after buying an additional 89,057 shares during the period. Wellington Management Group LLP grew its stake in Jamf by 6.2% in the 4th quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP now owns 7,871,450 shares of the company's stock valued at $142,158,000 after acquiring an additional 462,257 shares during the period. Price T Rowe Associates Inc. MD increased its holdings in Jamf by 7.5% in the 4th quarter. Price T Rowe Associates Inc. MD now owns 28,528 shares of the company's stock worth $516,000 after acquiring an additional 1,992 shares in the last quarter. Voloridge Investment Management LLC acquired a new position in Jamf during the fourth quarter worth $217,000. Finally, Prelude Capital Management LLC purchased a new position in Jamf during the fourth quarter valued at $388,000. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 95.11% of the company's stock. Analyst Ratings Changes A number of equities research analysts recently commented on the company. Royal Bank of Canada reiterated an "outperform" rating and issued a $21.00 target price on shares of Jamf in a research report on Thursday, March 14th. Barclays upped their price objective on shares of Jamf from $18.00 to $20.00 and gave the company an "equal weight" rating in a report on Thursday, March 14th. Needham & Company LLC reissued a "buy" rating and set a $25.00 target price on shares of Jamf in a report on Thursday, March 14th. Finally, Mizuho decreased their target price on shares of Jamf from $22.00 to $21.00 and set a "buy" rating for the company in a research report on Wednesday, February 28th. One research analyst has rated the stock with a hold rating and six have issued a buy rating to the company's stock. According to data from MarketBeat.com, the stock presently has a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" and a consensus price target of $23.67. Check Out Our Latest Analysis on JAMFAbout Jamf (Get Free Report) Jamf Holding Corp. offers a cloud software platform for Apple infrastructure and security platform in the Americas, Europe, the Middle. Its products include Jamf Pro, an Apple ecosystem management software solution for IT environments; Jamf Now, a pay-as-you-go Apple device management software solution for small-to-medium-sized businesses; Jamf Data Policy, a solution to enforce acceptable usage policies that keeps away from risky sites and content; Jamf School, an apple mobile device management for schools; and Jamf Connect, a ZTNA solution that replaces legacy conditional access and VPN technology.Read MoreFive stocks we like better than JamfHow to Use the MarketBeat Stock Screener Google and Meta Circling the Market on a TikTok Ban RallyWhat is the S&P 500 and How It is Distinct from Other IndexesIntuitive Machines: Charting a Course Among the StarsBuy P&G Now, Before It Sets A New All-Time HighKB Home’s Stock Price Can Move Higher, Here’s WhyThis instant news alert was generated by narrative science technology and financial data from MarketBeat in order to provide readers with the fastest and most accurate reporting.
